column4: Has anyone been able to get S-Video out working with an intel card?
Is there a cheap way of getting SCART tv-out from a VGA pot?
solder on a SCART connector; SCART has the same component wires that VGA has
do I need to do anything with the xorg?
why ? you're still using the same output
I read something about TVs using a lower refresh rates,
they do, that's what a TV out is for
So if I make (or more likely buy) a VGA to SCART cable, it will work without any setting changes?
that depends.. I would google for the signals first, as you don't want to blow up your video card doing that...
a thorough google should tell you if and how it is possible
thx
what card doesn't have tv out these days ? it must be old.. you can probably get a similar card with tv out for around $30
it's a laptop, and it has tv-out but I've had no luck getting that to work
ah... so you need to be able to use the laptop's function keys ? there is software for that
ah
it will depend in large part on the type of laptop, though
toshiba satellite
hmm.. should work I think
what software do I need?
I'm trying to remember what it's called... hmmm .. synaptic.. no, that's for the touchy-feely pad
I think I've found it thx (sry for being n00b)
yes ? so what was it called again ? (more people might want to know)
fnfxd is a package for toshiba laptops
ah.. not the one I was thinking of, but there you go, then :)
